greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of entries in the third cycles of all permutations of [n] when cycles are ordered by decreasing lengths.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..450
Andrew V. Sills, Integer Partitions Probability Distributions, arXiv:1912.05306 [math.CO], 2019.
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, l[3], add((j-1)!*b(n-j,
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, l[[3]], Sum[(j-1)! b[n-j, ReverseSort[ Append[l, j]][[1 ;; 3]]] Binomial[n - 1, j - 1], {j, 1, n}]];
a /@ Range[3, 23] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 01 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 26 2020
